recentPerformance.hitRate: 91% under rate (10 of 11 games failed to hit 4+ threes)

keyFactors.title: Career-Worst Three-Point Shooting
keyFactors.description: 27% from three vs 36.9% career average. Shooting 171st out of 178 qualified players—historically poor.

keyFactors.title: Elite Recent Under Rate
keyFactors.description: 91% under rate (10 of 11 games failed to hit 4+ threes). Consistent pattern of staying under line.

keyFactors.title: Volume Decline
keyFactors.description: Dropped from 10.2 3PA in October to 7.0 in November. Both volume and efficiency trending down.

keyFactors.title: Philadelphia Defense
keyFactors.description: 76ers ranked 8th in opponent 3PT% (34.8%). Solid perimeter defense to limit White's attempts.

keyFactors.title: Role Change
keyFactors.description: Both volume and efficiency declining indicated changing role in Celtics' offense.

riskFactors: Close game could increase volume attempts
White is career 36.9% shooter capable of variance
Matchup history—could have prior success vs Philadelphia

quarterBreakdown.description: White took elevated volume (11 three-point attempts) despite poor overall shooting. Game stayed competitive throughout.
Close game (final 102-100) kept White on floor for 35 minutes and hunting shots despite cold overall shooting (7-20 FG, 35%).

gameResults.whenMissed: White hit 4th three during game, clearing UNDER by exactly 0.5 threes.
gameResults.gamePace: Final score 102-100 (close game) meant White stayed on floor and kept shooting. Celtics needed scoring (Brown only 24 pts), so White's 18 on 7-20 shooting was necessary despite inefficiency.
gameResults.volumeSpike: White took 11 three-point attempts, tied for 2nd-most of season. This was 57% above his November average (7.0 attempts) and matched opening-night attempt total.

whatWentWrong.title: Volume Spike Was the Killer (PRIMARY FACTOR)
whatWentWrong.description: White took 11 three-point attempts, 57% above his November average (7.0 attempts). This volume spike created opportunity despite poor shooting.

whatWentWrong.title: Close Game Kept Him Shooting
whatWentWrong.description: Final score 102-100 meant White stayed on floor for 35 minutes and kept hunting shots despite cold overall shooting (7-20 FG, 35%).

whatWentWrong.title: Slight Efficiency Improvement
whatWentWrong.description: 36.4% (4-11) was above his 27% season average, though still well below career 36.9%. This was only his 3rd game all season shooting above 33% from three.

whatWentWrong.title: Celtics Needed Scoring
whatWentWrong.description: Brown led with only 24 points. White's 18 on 7-20 shooting was needed despite inefficiency.

whatWentWrong.title: Matchup History
whatWentWrong.description: Opening night vs Philadelphia, White went 4-13 from three (his other 4+ three game). Something about this matchup generated higher volume.

statisticalContext.percentileRanking: This wasn't a breakout—still inefficient (35% FG overall)
statisticalContext.historicalContext: Boston.com recap noted shooting 'felt like progress' given brutal cold streak

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Partially. White wasn't 'hot'—he shot just 36.4% from three (barely above 27% average) and 35% overall. The under failed due to VOLUME SPIKE (11 attempts vs 7 average) rather than efficiency breakout. One fewer make (3-11) would have cashed the under easily.

closingLineValue.verdict: Neutral to slight positive CLV. Line held steady around -165 to -170.

keyTakeaways: Volume matters more than efficiency for three-point props: 11 attempts vs 7-attempt average created opportunity despite poor shooting
Close games increase shot volume: 102-100 final meant White kept shooting despite cold night (7-20 FG)
Well-reasoned bets can lose narrowly: Lost by exactly 0.5 threes despite all analysis pointing toward under
Career-worst streaks eventually regress: Even at 27%, White is career 36.9% shooter; one decent night was inevitable
Matchup history matters: Both 4+ three games came vs Philadelphia, suggesting something about this opponent generated volume
White debuted new celebration (covering eyes/ears = see/hear no evil) acknowledging struggles
This wasn't a breakout—still inefficient (35% FG) with slightly improved 3PT%
verdict: Excellent analysis with strong edge, but volume spike in close game created narrow bad beat. Grade: B+
